courseInfo.title: Programming & Problem Solving
courseInfo.description: Develop logical thinking through coding, algorithms, and computational problem solving

modules.title: Programming Fundamentals
modules.description: Learn the basics of Python programming and computational thinking

content.reading: What is Programming? Understanding the basics of how computers work and why we program them.

exercises.question: What is the main purpose of programming?

exercises.prompt: Think of 3 problems in your daily life that could be solved with programming. Write them down and explain how programming might help.

content.reading: Learn about variables, strings, numbers, and how to store and manipulate data in Python.

exercises.title: Variable Practice
exercises.instructions: Create variables for your name, age, favorite color, and a number. Print them all out.
exercises.starter_code:
# Create your variables here



# Print them here
exercises.solution:
# Create your variables here
name = "Your Name"
age = 15
favorite_color = "blue"
number = 42

# Print them here
print("Name:", name)
print("Age:", age)
print("Favorite Color:", favorite_color)
print("Number:", number)

exercises.title: Personal Information Card
exercises.description: Create a program that displays your personal information in a formatted card.

content.reading: Master if/else statements, loops, and how to make your programs make decisions.

exercises.title: Number Guessing Game
exercises.instructions: Create a simple number guessing game using if/else statements.
exercises.starter_code:
import random
secret_number = random.randint(1, 10)

# Ask user for a guess
# Use if/else to tell them if they're right or wrong

exercises.title: Grade Calculator
exercises.description: Create a program that takes a test score and returns the letter grade (A, B, C, D, F).

content.reading: Learn to create reusable code blocks with functions and parameters.

exercises.title: Function Library
exercises.instructions: Create functions for common calculations: area of circle, temperature conversion, and factorial.

    # Convert celsius to fahrenheit
    pass

    # Calculate factorial
    pass

# Test your functions

project.title: Calculator App
project.description: Build a simple calculator that can perform basic arithmetic operations
requirements: Use functions for each operation (add, subtract, multiply, divide)
Handle user input and display results
Include error handling for division by zero

rubric.Functionality: Calculator performs all basic operations correctly
rubric.Error Handling: Properly handles invalid inputs and division by zero
rubric.Code Quality: Well-organized, commented code with proper functions

modules.title: Algorithm & Problem Solving
modules.description: Develop algorithmic thinking and problem-solving strategies

content.reading: What are algorithms? Understanding step-by-step problem-solving approaches.

exercises.title: Daily Routine Algorithm
exercises.description: Write down your morning routine as a step-by-step algorithm. Identify any decision points or loops.

exercises.title: Making a Sandwich
exercises.description: Write pseudocode for making a sandwich. Include all steps and decision points.

content.reading: Learn about lists, dictionaries, and when to use different data structures.

exercises.title: Student Grade Tracker
exercises.instructions: Create a program that stores student names and grades using appropriate data structures.
exercises.starter_code:
# Create a dictionary to store student grades
students = {}

# Add some sample data
# Write functions to add students, get grades, and calculate averages

resources: When to Use Lists vs Dictionaries

content.reading: Learn about linear search, binary search, and basic sorting algorithms.

exercises.title: Implement Linear Search
exercises.instructions: Write a function that finds a number in a list using linear search.
exercises.starter_code:
def linear_search(numbers, target):
    # Implement linear search
    # Return the index if found, -1 if not found
    pass

# Test your function
numbers = [4, 2, 7, 1, 9, 3, 6]
print(linear_search(numbers, 7))  # Should return 2
print(linear_search(numbers, 5))  # Should return -1

exercises.title: Algorithm Visualization
exercises.description: Create a visual representation of how a sorting algorithm works using drawings or animations.

project.title: Problem Solving Portfolio
project.description: Solve 5 different programming problems and document your approach
problems: Find the largest number in a list
Check if a string is a palindrome
Find common elements in two lists
requirements: Solve each problem using different approaches
Include time and space complexity analysis
Create a presentation of your solutions

modules.title: Web Development
modules.description: Build interactive web applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

content.reading: Learn HTML structure, elements, and how to create web pages.

exercises.title: Personal Profile Page
exercises.instructions: Create an HTML page with your personal information, including headings, paragraphs, and lists.
exercises.starter_code:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>My Profile</title>
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Add your content here -->
</body>
</html>
exercises.solution:
My Personal Profile

About Me

I am a student learning programming and web development.

My Skills

  • Python Programming
  • Problem Solving
  • Web Development

My Goals

  1. Master programming fundamentals
  2. Build real-world projects
  3. Learn advanced algorithms

content.reading: Learn CSS selectors, properties, and how to style your web pages.

exercises.title: Style Your Profile Page
exercises.instructions: Add CSS to make your profile page look professional and attractive.

content.reading: Learn JavaScript basics and how to add interactivity to web pages.

exercises.title: Interactive Calculator
exercises.instructions: Create a simple calculator using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

project.title: Personal Website
project.description: Create a complete personal website showcasing your skills and projects
requirements: Responsive design that works on mobile and desktop
pages: About page with skills and experience

questions.question: What is the output of print(2 + 3 * 4)?
Which data type is used to store text in Python?
What does the range(5) function return?

assessments.title: Problem Solving Challenge
assessments.description: Solve a real-world programming problem within 30 minutes
assessments.problem: Write a function that finds the second largest number in a list without using built-in sort functions.

certificate.title: Programming Fundamentals Certificate
requirements: Complete all modules with 80% or higher
